alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Etowah; St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 8:16AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Calhoun, southwestern Etowah and northeastern St. Clair Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 815 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rainbow City, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Anniston, Oxford, Jacksonville, Rainbow City, Attalla, Cobb Town, West End-Cobb Town, Fort McClellan, Saks, Glencoe, Weaver, Ohatchee, Steele, Hobson City, Reece City, Blue Mountain, Alexandria, Jacksonville State University and Gadsden Mall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
